ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 52
ygData.msgSnippet: I sold a full suit of banded for 120 plat today. I made 70 plat profit. I said my price is higher than most, I said I wouldn t sell for lower, and I gave the
ygData.messageBody:
I sold a full suit of banded for 120 plat today. I made 70 plat profit. I said
my price is higher than most, I said I wouldn't sell for lower, and I gave the
buyer the option to shop around and find a better price or to buy from me right
then and there. Well, I sold the suit :) People pay the prices, and the more of
us that sell for a higher price, the rarer the cheap banded, and the more
willing they are to pay our price instead of shopping around. I'm not trying to
be greedy, but my time invested into smithing is worth more than a few plat per
sale, or in some cases, actually losing money. I won't continue to lose money, I
am not dropping my prices. I sell fine at 130 per suit (will drop to 120), 6 per
gorget, 12 per mask, 14 per helmet, 8 per bracer, 13 per sleeves, 14 per mantle,
20 per mail, 19 per cloak, 13 per belt, 19 per leggings, 13 per boots.
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

David Bradshaw wrote:

> From: "David Bradshaw" <Logain@...>
>
> Exactly the fact is we can factor in the costs of our failures or we can let
> players deflate the costs. If we won't sell for less what are they going to
> do?? Summon it? I don't think so... Seems there is one place it comes from
> that is smiths if we don't sell it for almost nothing they can't buy it for
> almost nothing no matter how much they suck or are mean or whatever.
>
> I haven't bothered to even make any unless they will buy for the prices I
> mentioned awhile ago. You can say people won't pay that. I say fine then
> they won't get any armor from me. Now if you go and make it for the same
> price you are the one allowing them to get away with it. They WILL pay the
> minimum we will sell it for or they won't get it simple.
>
> Do you think GM will sell cars for a loss if people moan and groan enough. I
> doubt it very much!
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
> Date: Saturday, July 10, 1999 12:48 PM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 52
>
> >From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> >
> >you should really look at the archives of EQ_Blacksmiths. Of course, you
> >specifically wouldn't want to. Too many flames aimed towards your kind and
> people
> >who refuse to see the logic of a successful business.
> >
> >To clarify, this is not a personal attack at you. This is a generalized
> statement
> >about smiths (our own kind!) who are ruining the business and refuse to
> stop.
> >
> >-Rennin of E'Ci
> > Trade Council GM
> >
> >Talthoron@... wrote:
> >
> >> From: Talthoron@...
> >>
> >> That is the business world. You want to know what else? They don't care
> one
> >> bit for your failures either. They are buying the successes. No one
> wantes
> >> to pay for the ones you screw up on, they are not buying the skewers you
> used
> >> to practice with either. If anything, get anrgy with EQ on the sucess
> ratio.
> >> Once something is trivial, I think it should be VERY rare that you fail.
> >>
> >> Talthoron
